results.content: I would have enjoyed more explanation of the source code during the individual lectures where we were writing it, instead of having it all at the end. But overall, it was a good course. I was able to customize the game and have fun with it.

response.content: Thank you for your wonderful review and feedback, please note that there were some perquisites to the course so not everything was as in depth as it would be without those.

results.content:
0% filler.

It is exactly as advertised: within the specified time you'll have everything it claims. Everything is focused, at a natural pace, at getting your jQuery site up and running, with no extraneous content.

The instructor makes the code (that he is adding/changing) legible so you can see exactly where you should be, and includes the correct code at the end of each lesson. Each lesson is a manageable 4-9 minutes, and not overwhelming.

response.content: Thank you for sharing your feedback and for the wonderful review.  Glad you are enjoying the course best wishes.
response.content_html: Thank you for sharing your feedback and for the wonderful review. Glad you are enjoying the course best wishes.

0% filler.

It is exactly as advertised: within the specified time you'll have everything it claims. Everything is focused, at a natural pace, at getting your jQuery site up and running, with no extraneous content.

The instructor makes the code (that he is adding/changing) legible so you can see exactly where you should be, and includes the correct code at the end of each lesson. Each lesson is a manageable 4-9 minutes, and not overwhelming.

results.content:
Assuming you have some prior knowledge of javaScript and CSS then this course is golden as it will put a lot of perspective / context of what you know into some applied examples as the game builds up. 

WARNING - If you are a total beginner with javaScript (mostly) and to some extend with HTML / CSS you will have some hard time following along with this course.  Otherwise this course is definitely a fun way to engage and apply your theoretical knowledge of javaScript / HTML / CSS  into a fun game.  

Thumbs up for the author's presentation style, voice clarity and short modules for each component of the game as it builds up from scratch.

Now - you can let your imagination run wild as to what you can place instead of a "Mole" ...

response.content: Thanks for sharing your feedback and review
response.content_html: Thanks for sharing your feedback and review

results.content: nice for a free course, although I got a bit lost on the lecture when he started to write the makeGameBoard function, maybe its just me because I am still a beginner in JQuery although a more detailed explaination would have been much better.

response.content: There are prerequisites to the course as the scope is based on developing the game.  That function is a loop which build the squares for the game board making it dynamic, and I'm always available in the Q&A to help if needed.
